ul.li: Published by: Health Level Seven International US Realm Steering Committee

div.p: The Section describes the expected capabilities of the US Core Server actor which is responsible for providing responses to the queries submitted by the US Core Requestors. The complete list of FHIR profiles, RESTful operations, and search parameters supported by US Core Servers are defined. Systems implementing this capability statement should meet the ONC 2015 Common Clinical Data Set (CCDS) access requirement for Patient Selection 170.315(g)(7) and Application Access - Data Category Request 170.315(g)(8). US Core Clients have the option of choosing from this list to access necessary data based on their local use cases and other contextual requirements.

ol.li: Support the US Core Patient resource profile.
Support at least one additional resource profile from the list of US Core Profiles.
Implement the RESTful behavior according to the FHIR specification.

Return the following response classes:
(Status 200): successful operation
(Status 400): invalid parameter
(Status 401/4xx): unauthorized request
(Status 403): insufficient scope
(Status 404): unknown resource
(Status 410): deleted resource.
Support jsonesource formats for all US Core interactions.
Declare a CapabilityStatement identifying the list of profiles, operations, search parameter supported.
Support xmlesource formats for all US Core interactions.
Identify the US Core profiles supported as part of the FHIR meta.profilettribute for each instance.
Implement the security requirementsocumented in the this IG.
A server has ensured that every API request includes a valid Authorization token, supplied via: Authorization: Bearer {server-specific-token-here}
A server has rejected any unauthorized requests by returning an HTTP 401nauthorized response code.
All servers SHALLake available the readnd searchnteractions for the Profiles the server chooses to support.
All servers SHOULDake available the vreadnd history-instancenteractions for the Profiles the server chooses to support.

p.strong: Summary of US Core search criteria

div.p: Specific server search capabilities are described in detail in each of the resource sections below.

tr.td: name , family , given , identifier , gender , birthdate , name + gender , name + birthdate , family + gender , given + gender
patient , category , status , date, patient + category , patient + category + date , patient + category + status , patient + category + status + date
patient , category , clinicalstatus, patient + clinicalstatus , patient + category
patient , category , code , date, patient + category , patient + category + date , patient + category + code, patient + category + code + date
patient , patient + period + type , patient + date + $docref
US Core Result Observation Profile, Vital Signs Profile, US Core Smoking Status Observation Profile
patient , category , code , date, patient + category , patient + category + date , patient + category + code, patient + category + code + date

div.p: Supported Profiles: US Core Patient Profile

li.p: A server SHALLe capable of returning a patient using:
GET [base]/Patient/[id].
A server SHALLe capable of returning a patient by identifier using
A server SHALLe capbable of returning a patient by supporting at a minimum the following search parameters when at least 2 are present:
birthdate
for example:

A server SHALLe capable of returning a patient’s Assessment and Plan of Treatment information over a specified time period using:

A server SHOULDe capable returning a patient’s active Assessment and Plan of Treatment information over a specified time period using

li.p: A server SHALLe capable of returning a patient’s current care team members using:

div.p: Supported Profiles: US Core Condition Profile

li.p: A server SHALLe capable of returning all problems and health concerns for a patient, including current as well as historical problems and health concerns using:
A server SHOULDe capable returning all of a patient’s activeroblems and health concerns using:
A server SHOULDe capable returning all of a patient’s problems or all of patient’s health concerns using:

div.p: Supported Profiles: US Core Device Profile

li.p: A server SHALLe capable of returning all Unique device identifier(s)(UDI) for a patient’s implanted device(s):

div.p: Supported Profiles: US Core DiagnosticReport Profile

li.p: A server SHALLe capable of returning all of a patient’s laboratory diagnostic reports queried by category using:
A server SHALLe capable of returning all of a patient’s laboratory diagnostic reports queried by category code and date range using:
A server SHALLe capable of returning all of a patient’s laboratory diagnostic reports queried by category and code using:
A server SHOULDe capable of returning all of a patient’s laboratory diagnostic reports queried by category and one or more codes and date range using:

div.p: Supported Profiles: US Core DocumentReference Profile

li.p: A server SHALLe capable of returning all of a patient’s DocumentReferences using:
A server SHALLe capable of responding to a $docrefperation. At minimum, it must return a reference to a CCD document.
A server SHOULDe capable of returning all of all of a patient’s DocumentReferences for a given time period and document type:

li.p: A server SHALLe capable of returning all of a patient’s encounters using:
A server SHALLe capable of returning all of all of a patient’s encounters over a specified time period using:

div.p: Supported Profiles: US Core Medication Profile

The MedicationStatement and MedicationRequest resources can represent a medication, using an external reference to a Medication resource. If an external Medication Resource is used in a MedicationStatement or a MedicationRequest, then the READ and SEARCH Criteria SHALL be supported.
Supported Profiles: US Core MedicationStatement Profile

The MedicationStatement resources can represent a medication using either a code or refer to the Medication resource. When referencing a Medication resource, the resource may be containedr an external resource. The server application MAYhoose any one way or more than one method, but ifn external reference to Medication is used, the server SHALLupport the _include arameter for searching this element. The client application must support all methods.
A server SHALLe capable of returning all medications for a patient using one of or both:
Supported Profiles: US Core MedicationRequest Profile

The MedicationRequest resources can represent a medication using either a code or refer to the Medication resource. When referencing a Medication resource, the resource may be containedr an external resource. The server application MAYhoose any one way or more than one method, but ifn external reference to Medication is used, the server SHALLupport the _include arameter for searching this element. The client application must support all methods.
A server SHALLe capable of returning all medications for a patient using one of or both:

li.p: Search Criteria:
A server SHALLe capable of returning all of a patient’s laboratory results queried by category using:
A server SHALLe capable of returning all of a patient’s laboratory results queried by category code and date range using:
A server SHALLe capable of returning all of a patient’s laboratory results queried by category and code using:
A server SHOULDe capable of returning all of a patient’s laboratory results queried by category and one or more codes and date range using:
Search Criteria:
A server SHALLe capable of returning all of a patient’s vital signs that it supports using:
A server SHALLe capable of returning all of a patient’s vital signs queried by date range using:
A server SHALLe capable of returning any of a patient’s vital signs queried by one or more of the codes listed below using:
A server SHOULDe capable of returning any of a patient’s vital signs queried by one or more of the codes listed below and date range using:

div.p: Supported Profiles: US Core Procedure Profile

li.p: A server SHALLe capable of returning a patient’s procedures using: GET/Procedure?patient=[id]
A server SHALLe capable of returning all of a patient’s procedures over a specified time period using: GET /Procedure?patient=[id]&date=[date]{&date=[date]}

description.value: This profile defines the expected capabilities of the US Core Server conforming to the US Core IG.

documentation.value: Allows discovery of existing US Core patient resources using different search criteria
Allows retrieval of a specific US Core patients by id
Allows review of changes to US Core patient instance over time
Allows retrieval of a historical version of a US Core patient instance
Allows discovery of existing US Core AllergyIntolerance resources using different search criteria
Allows retrieval of a specific US Core AllergyIntolerance by id
Allows review of changes to US Core AllergyIntolerance instance over time
Allows retrieval of a historical version of a US Core AllergyIntolerance instance
Allows discovery of existing US Core careplan resources using different search criteria
Allows retrieval of a specific US Core careplan by id
Allows review of changes to US Core careplan instance over time
Allows retrieval of a historical version of a US Core careplan instance
The server SHALL support the date search modifiers 'ge','le','gt', and 'lt'

Allows retrieval of a historical version of a US Core careteam instance
